Assignment_1.5

1) Create an m x n matrix with replicate(m, rnorm(n)) with m=10 column vectors of n=10 each, constructed with rnorm(n), which creates random normal numbers.

set.seed(42);
m=10; n=10;
mat<-replicate(m, rnorm(n)) # create matrix of normal random numbers
df=data.frame(mat)    # transform into data frame

#we can use system.stem() to check how long this takes
system.time(for (i in 1:m) {
  for (j in 1:n) {
    df[i,j]<-df[i,j] + 10*sin(0.75*pi)
  }
}
)
df

       X1       X2       X3       X4       X5       X6       X7       X8       X9      X10
1  8.442026 8.375937 6.764429 7.526518 7.277066 7.392993 6.703833 6.027949 8.583775 8.463184
2  6.506370 9.357713 5.289759 7.775905 6.710011 6.287229 7.256298 6.980881 7.328989 6.594894

5  7.475336 6.937746 8.966261 7.576023 5.702787 7.160828 6.343776 6.528239 5.876739 5.960279
6  6.964943 7.707018 6.640599 5.354059 7.503886 7.347619 8.373610 7.652064 7.683065 6.210275

8  6.976409 4.414612 5.307905 6.220160 8.515169 7.160901 8.109574 7.534835 6.888311 5.611854
9  9.089492 4.630601 7.531165 4.656860 6.639622 4.077978 7.991796 6.185292 8.004414 7.151050
